newsitem.title: BELGIUM: Belgian Renault workers protest at plant closure.
newsitem.headline: Belgian Renault workers protest at plant closure.

text.p: Some 3,500 people marched through the streets of Vilvoorde, near Brussels on Sunday in a peaceful protest against the planned closure of the local Renault car assembly plant.
The march, supported by all political parties, involved mainly local families and young people worried that the area would lose its main livelihood with little prospect of alternative employment.
"Vilvoorde is Renault and Renault is Vilvoorde," said one woman marcher.
On Friday, angry Belgian Renault workers hurled a car chassis across police barricades as they demonstrated outside the French embassy in Brussels.

They were trying to reverse a decision by Paris-based Renault to close its Vilvoorde plant with the loss of 3,100 jobs. Thousands more jobs could be lost among the plant's suppliers, dealers and repairers.
The French state holds a 46 percent stake in Renault and unions have charged that the company targeted the Belgian plant in its restructuring to avoid heavy job losses in France.
